intro: Osteospermum acutifolium, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Osteospermum acutifolium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
